title: Bug 9619: Move static member: Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619: Move static member: Dialog details 20020212a.
Mnemonics.
No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for the superclass), so it could be done. At least isValidTypeName().
Label could say 'Select destination type:'.
Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes).
Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
Destination type can be the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
OB:
Browse button is too small.
Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
Destination type can be the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
EB:
The browse button should have a standard size.
The title should not be used for long text. When going to the next page, it should not say 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
Refactoring should not warn that using the source type as the destination type will result in errors and make pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
SR:
To reproduce the bug:
1. Open the dialog for moving a static member.
2. Notice that the browse button is too small.
3. Enter long text in the title field.
4. Proceed to the next page of the dialog.
5. Observe that it says 'Type not found'.
6. Display the types in the dialog and notice that it shows types from folders other than the source folders of the current project.
7. Try to select the source type as the destination type and observe the warning and the pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
